newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian castorseed steadies on forward trade news.
newsitem.headline: Indian castorseed steadies on forward trade news.

text.p: Indian castorseed September delivery prices held steady at 1,135/1,136 rupees per quintal as the market absorbed news that foreign funds would be allowed in castor oil futures trade, dealers said.
Volumes were low due to poor attendance among operators following continuous rain in the city.
An Indian government spokesman said Tuesday's cabinet decision would enable an inflow of foreign funds in the domestic commodity market.
But dealers said this had little impact on trading.

Groundnut oil was steady at 362/364 rupees per 10 kg amid limited arrivals of 40/50 tonnes while local buying was at a low ebb. In Rajkot spot groundnut oil rose by five rupees at 560/565 rupees per 15 kg.
In Bombay, imported palm oil initially fell from 260 rupees to 256 rupees on fresh offerings but later on prices recovered to 258 rupees per 10 kg following reports of a recovery in the world market.
